page.title: 16Farming in Glenisla. contd.
page.content: Only two farms are privately owned, the other four being tenant farmers. These farmers have been resident in the Glen for an average of sixteen years. Employment on the farms is low although four farms use casual labour for lambing and harvesting. On the whole the farmers enjoy their work and list the good points as _ healthy outdoor life, job satisfaction, especially during spring and summer months and the pleasure of watching nature at work. The unpleasant aspects are listed as _ severe winter conditions making the feeding of animals difficult and the loss of early lambs a problem. All the farmers appear dissatisfied with the present government policies giving a poor return for their long hours and hard work.
